fullText: Caryl Churchill's latest play is a masterpiece of economy and precision, building to a devastating climax that feels both inevitable and shocking.

bwwExcerpt: But for all its clever construction, I doubt "The Children" would feel so important without Rose's agenda and the challenge that comes with it. I will say only that it has to do with selfishness in both its ordinary and also its existential varieties. When Rose tells Robin that "we can't have everyt...
